column2: The pre WW2 territorial integrity of Germany must be preserved.
The Germans will lose only Silesia.
The Germans shall lose everything past the Oder-Neisse line.
A new Prussian republic and everything past the Oder-Neisse line to Poland.
A republic shall be formed in Prussia and Silesia given to Poland.
The Eastern German Territories will remain, with Prussia as an independent republic.
All save for Silesia belongs to a new Prussia.
All belongs to a new Prussia.

With the defeat of the nazi regime, the question has arisen of what to do with the occupied territory. Some argue that everything past the Oder-Neisse line must be given to Poland, others that territorial integrity must be maintained. The fate of the East of Germany is in your hands.
